subject: Re: Toba-Fushimi through Nagakura's eyes

He did indeed record the entire book in the third person. Not
uncommon, aft=
er all, Caesar's "Bellum Gallicum" was written in the
third person too.

--=
- In SHQ@yahoogroups.com, "secretary" <secretarytocapt3@...> wrote:
>
> ---=
 In SHQ@yahoogroups.com, "M." <myoe112@> wrote:
> >
> > "On the 3rd, 25 or =
26 men under Okita, Nagakura, Harada and others,
> > were gathered in the m=
eeting hall of the Fushimi Magistrate's offices,
> > and drinking good sake=
. Around 4 PM they saw Satsuma men rolling
> > cannons into position around=
 Gokomiya...."
> 
> **I wonder....
> 
> Okita, "Ummm this is some good sake=
 it's making me see things..."
> 
> Harada "Yeah I see cannons being moved =
around..."
> 
> Nagakura "Should we tell someone?"
> 
> Okita "If we told t=
he Bakufu command would they care or listen to us?"
> 
> So I wonder if the=
 "higher ups" were informed at all.  Or was it a wait 
> and see game --- o=
bviously the cannons illustrated Satsuma intent to 
> use them (duh) but th=
is description by Old Nagakura is a bit weird.
> 
> It would be hilarious i=
f he recorded all this in the third person
> 
> "M." <myoe112@> wrote:
> So=
me of us
> > know the story of Nagakura being pulled up over a wall at
> > =
Toba-Fushimi; apparently this is it. For the longest time I thought it
> > =
was a spear Shimada used, but apparently it was a rifle.
> 
> **I've seen J=
apanese fanart where Nagakura is hanging from Shimada 
> Kai's spear too!
>=
